data.title: Río Escondido · Cinegogía
data.meta_description: Cinegogía is an open-access curated module for pedagogical resources in Spanish and English related to Latin American film studies. The website includes the following collections of materials: cinematographic glossaries and dictionaries, sample syllabi for teaching film at different levels of the Spanish curriculum, curated articles and readings, a searchable film database, film guides for frequently taught movies, assignment suggestions, guides to editing movie clips, and links to useful resources for teaching Latin American film.
data.text:
Description / Descripción

Por encargo del propio presidente de la república y a pesar de que está enferma del corazón, la maestra rural Rosaura Salazar sale rumbo al pueblo de Río Escondido para encargarse de la escuela que lleva meses cerrada. Tras su llegada, Rosaura debe enfrentar al cacique Regino Sandoval, quien explota y niega el agua a los campesinos y ha clausurado la escuela. (Cine Mexicano)

On request of the president of the Republic and despite the fact that she has a heart condition, the rural teacher Rosaura Salazar goes towards the town of Rio Escondido to take charge of the school that has been closed for months. Upon arrival, Rosaura must face the chief Regino Sandoval, who exploits and denies water to farmers and has closed the school. (Translation by Jessica Batista)
